properties.areaDesc: Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass
properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 15 at 9:59AM MST until January 17 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM TO BRING HEAVY SNOW TO THE NORTHERN MOUNTAINS...

.A complex winter storm system will bring several inches of snow
to northern New Mexico. The highest snow accumulations will found
above 7500 feet with accumulations ranging from 4 to 8 inches and
over a foot possible in mountain peaks. Very strong westerly winds
on Friday may also create areas of blowing snow across northern
New Mexico. This winter storm system will also bring the
possibility of freezing rain to east central portions of the
state on Thursday.

* WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8
inches, except up to 15 inches above 7500 feet possible. Winds
could gust as high as 65 mph on Friday.

* WHERE...Northern Mountains, and Glorieta Mesa Including
Glorieta Pass.

* WHEN...From late tonight through Friday afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Strong winds could
cause tree damage on Friday.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON
